intro: Eriocaulon obtusum, commonly known as the blunt-leaved spikerush, is a member of the Cyperaceae family, characterized by its grass-like appearance and cylindrical flower clusters. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and swampy areas, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Its rhizomes help it spread vegetatively, allowing it to form dense stands in suitable environments. Eriocaulon obtusum plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
